name: reference
title: Reference
description: Structured bibliographic references with a unique id to refer to from other entities. References can be given either as a simple, single citation string, or in a structured form. ColDP supports fully parsed references in CSV based on the CSL-JSON format. Alternatively references can also be provided in the native file formats for the well established BibTex or CSL-JSON formats. See the sections below with for how to share alternative formats that do not conform to tabular CSV/TSV files.

fields.name: ID
fields.title: ID
fields.description: The local identifier for the reference as used in referenceID in other entities.

fields.name: alternativeID
fields.title: alternativeID
fields.description: A comma concatenated list of alternative identifiers for the reference. Every alternative identifier must be a URI/URN/URL or given in the form of scope:id. See identifiers for all details and common scopes.

fields.name: sourceID
fields.title: sourceID
fields.description: Optional identifier for the source this record came from as listed in the metadata.yaml

fields.name: citation
fields.title: citation
fields.description: Full bibliographic citation as one single string as an alternative to the rest of the more structured fields. If individual fields are given the full citation can be ignored.

fields.name: author
fields.title: author
fields.description: The author(s) of the work. If multiple authors use a style that can safely be parsed. Recommended are 2 common forms:

fields.name: editor
fields.title: editor
fields.description: The editor(s) of the work. See author for recommendations how to supply person names.

fields.name: title
fields.title: title
fields.description: The title of the work. In case of journal articles the article title, not the journal itself.

fields.name: titleShort
fields.title: titleShort
fields.description: The abbreviated title of the work.

fields.name: containerAuthor
fields.title: containerAuthor
fields.description: Author(s) of the container holding the item, e.g. the book author for a book chapter. See author for recommendations how to supply person names.

fields.name: containerTitle
fields.title: containerTitle
fields.description: Title of the container holding the item, e.g. the book title for a book chapter, the journal title for a journal article. The containerTitle should exclude volume, edition, pages and other specifics.

fields.name: containerTitleShort
fields.title: containerTitleShort
fields.description: The abbreviated container title.

fields.name: collectionTitle
fields.title: collectionTitle
fields.description: Title of the collection holding the item, e.g. the series title for a book.

fields.name: collectionEditor
fields.title: collectionEditor
fields.description: Editor(s) of the collection holding the item, e.g. the series editor for a book.

fields.name: page
fields.title: page
fields.description: Range of pages the item (e.g. a journal article) covers in a container (e.g. a journal issue)

fields.name: publisher
fields.title: publisher
fields.description: Name of the publisher

fields.name: publisherPlace
fields.title: publisherPlace
fields.description: Geographic location of the publisher

fields.name: version
fields.title: version
fields.description: Version of the item or dataset

fields.name: isbn
fields.title: isbn
fields.description: International Standard Book Number

fields.name: issn
fields.title: issn
fields.description: International Standard Serial Number

fields.name: doi
fields.title: doi
fields.description: The DOI of the reference

fields.name: link
fields.title: link
fields.description: A URL link to the reference. A link to a webpage for electronic resources. url in CSL-JSON terminology, but we prefer link to be consistent with other ColDP entities.

fields.name: remarks
fields.title: remarks
fields.description: Additional comments about the reference. note in CSL-JSON terminology, but we prefer remarks to be consistent with other ColDP entities.

fields.name: modified
fields.title: modified
fields.description: UTC timestamp in ISO format to represent the time the record was last modified.

fields.name: modifiedBy
fields.title: modifiedBy
fields.description: Author identifier indicating the person who has last modified the record.
